member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions
member.summary:
Enum values used with Trace connection property.
Trace options specify what type of tracing, if any, to start on the iSeries host. If more than one trace option is desired, specify it in the connection string separated by commas, for example:
Trace=PrintJoblog, TraceJob.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.Default
member.summary: Do not start any host traces.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.DatabaseMonitor
member.summary: Enable Database Monitor tracing.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.StartDebug
member.summary: Enable the Start Debug command.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.PrintJoblog
member.summary: Print the host server joblog at disconnect.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.TraceJob
member.summary: Enable job trace.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2TraceOptions.TraceDatabaseServer
member.summary: Enable tracing of the host Database Server component.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2NamingConvention
member.summary:
Enum values used with the Naming connection property.
Specifies which naming convention to use for SQL requests.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2NamingConvention.SQL
member.summary: Use SQL naming convention. The schema qualifier is a period ("."). Unqualified objects are resolved as defined in the DB2 UDB for iSeries documentation.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2NamingConvention.System
member.summary: Use System naming convention. The schema qualifier is a slash ("/"). Unqualified objects are resolved as defined in the DB2 UDB for iSeries documentation.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2QueryOptimizeGoal
member.summary: Enum values used with QueryOptimizeGoal connection property.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2QueryOptimizeGoal.Default
member.summary: Optimize queries using the default algorithm.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2QueryOptimizeGoal.FirstBlock
member.summary: Optimize queries for the first block of data.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2QueryOptimizeGoal.FullQuery
member.summary: Optimize queries for reading all the data.

member.summary: Begins a database transaction for this connection. The transaction isolation level used is the one specified by the DefaultIsolationLevel property.

member.summary: Begins a database transaction for this connection using the specified IsolationLevel.

member.summary: Begins a database transaction for this connection using the specified IsolationLevel.
member.param: The IsolationLevel to use for this transaction.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Connection.ChangeDatabase(System.String)
member.summary: Change the Database (IASP) for the connection. The only time the Database can be changed is in the ConnectionString before the connection is opened. If the dbName parameter passed to ChangeDatabase is the same name as the database we connected to, then no error will occur. If the dbName parameter is different from the database we connected to, then an exception will be thrown.
member.param: The Database (IASP) to use for this connection.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable
member.summary: iDB2Searchable: tells whether or not data in the column is searchable, and if so, with what options.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.Never
member.summary: Data in the column cannot be used in any WHERE clause.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.AllExceptLike
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause with any comparison operator except LIKE.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.Always
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause with any comparison operator.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Searchable.OnlyWithLike
member.summary: Data in the column can be used in a WHERE clause, but only with the LIKE predicate.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode
member.summary: iDB2GenerationMode: tells whether or not data in the column is generated always, or by default. This only applies to Rowid and Identity columns.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode.Always
member.summary: Data in the column is always generated by the iSeries host.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2GenerationMode.ByDefault
member.summary: Data in the column is generated by default by the iSeries host.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an IEnumerator used to enumerate through the result set.
member.remarks: This is especially useful for a Web Forms-based DataGrid where a Data Reader can be directly bound as a DataSource.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the iDB2DataReader.
member.remarks: Once the Data Reader is closed, the command is freed for processing more commands.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.NextResult
member.summary: Advances the iDB2DataReader to the next result set.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Read
member.summary: Advances the iDB2DataReader to the next record.
member.remarks: If a record is successfully read, True is returned. False means either no records exist, or the last record was already read and the reader is positioned past the end of the table.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a boolean value indicating whether or not the iDB2DataReader is closed. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.RecordsAffected
member.summary: Gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted as a result of executing the command.
member.remarks: If no rows were affected by the command, or if the statement failed, 0 is returned. SELECT statements and stored procedure calls return -1.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.FieldCount
member.summary: Gets the number of fields in the current row. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.HasRows
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the iDB2DataReader contains one or more rows. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an Object which represents the specified column. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an Object which represents the specified column. This property is read-only.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.IncrementCurrentRow
member.summary: Increment the current row.
member.remarks: This is always atomic so there is no need to protect the CurrentRow property above.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.IncrementCurrentRowInBlock
member.summary: Increment the current row in the current block.
member.remarks: This is always atomic so there is no need to protect the CurrentRow property above.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.StopFetch
member.summary: Method for manually stopping the fetch thread.
member.remarks: This method closes the event, freeing the WaitOne call in the fetch thread. It also closes the fetchDone event so it is cleaned up quickly.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.FetchData(System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: This method calls the underlying command to do a fetch and sets the rowsReturned and the block number returned from Dc.
member.param: Number of rows returned.
Block number returned.
member.returns: True if end of data. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.ReleaseBlock(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Releases a block of Dc result set data. This method does block zero checking.
member.remarks: Only unused blocks should be released.
member.param: The block number to release.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.CurrentBlock
member.summary: Property for getting and setting the current block number.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.CurrentRow
member.summary: Returns the current row or BORS if at the beginning of a result set.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.EndOfData
member.summary: Property for setting or getting EndOfData.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.CurrentRowInBlock

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.CurrentRowsInBlock
member.summary: Property for getting and setting the next rows returned.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DataReader.MPDataReader.ExitFetch
member.summary: Property for getting and setting a value indicating that the fetch thread should exit.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType
member.summary: iDB2DbType - enumeration for every data type supported by the IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries provider.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2BigInt
member.summary: An 8-byte signed binary number with a precision of 19 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Integer
member.summary: A 4-byte signed binary number with a precision of 10 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2SmallInt
member.summary: A 2-byte signed binary number with a precision of 5 digits.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Decimal
member.summary: A packed decimal number with an implicit decimal point.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Numeric
member.summary: A zoned decimal number with an implicit decimal point.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Char
member.summary: A fixed-length character string that can contain single-byte data from a single-byte character set, UTF8 data from ccsid 1208, or mixed data from a mixed-byte character set.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarChar
member.summary: A variable-length character string that can contain single-byte data from a single-byte character set, UTF8 data from ccsid 1208, or mixed data from a mixed-byte character set.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2CharBitData
member.summary: A fixed-length character string whose data is normally not converted. The ccsid for this data type is 65535.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarCharBitData
member.summary: A variable-length character string whose data is normally not converted. The ccsid for this data type is 65535.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Graphic
member.summary: A double-byte, fixed-length character string which can contain DBCS data encoded in a DBCS CCSID, UTF16 data from ccsid 1200, or UCS-2 data encoded in the universal coded character set (13488).

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarGraphic
member.summary: A double-byte, variable-length character string which can contain DBCS data encoded in a DBCS CCSID, UTF16 data from ccsid 1200, or UCS-2 data encoded in the universal coded character set (13488).

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Date
member.summary: A date value that contains Year, Month, and Day elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Time
member.summary: A time value that contains Hour, Minute, and Second elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2TimeStamp
member.summary: A timestamp value that contains Year, Month, Day, Hour, Minute, Second, and Microsecond elements.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Rowid
member.summary: A value that uniquely identifies a row in a table.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Real
member.summary: A single-precision floating point number which is a 32-bit approximate representation of a real number.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Double
member.summary: A double-precision floating point number which is an IEEE 64-bit approximate representation of a real number.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Binary
member.summary: A fixed-length sequence of binary bytes.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2VarBinary
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of binary bytes.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Blob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of binary bytes. used for storing large objects.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2Clob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of characters. used for storing large objects.

member.name: F:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DbType.iDB2DbClob
member.summary: A variable-length sequence of double-byte characters used for storing large objects.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Error

member.summary: Gets a string value that describes the error. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Error.MessageDetails
member.summary: Gets a string value that may contain more detailed information about the error. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Error.MessageCode
member.summary: Gets a value that may give more detailed information about the error. In some cases, this will contain an SQL error code. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Error.SqlState
member.summary: A String value that contains the SQLSTATE returned from the host server. This property will only return useful information for SQL errors. This property is read-only.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ErrorCollection
member.summary: A collection of iDB2Error objects that are associated with an exception. The iDB2ErrorCollection always contains at least one iDB2Error.

member.summary: Returns an IEnumerator for the error collection.

member.summary: Copies the elements of the error collection to the specified zero-based Array, starting at the specified array index.
member.param: The array to copy the error collection into.
The index within the error collection from which to start the copy.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ErrorCollection.Count
member.summary: The number of iDB2Error objects in the collection.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ErrorCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the iDB2Error at the specified index.

member.summary: The collection of one or more iDB2Error objects. The iDB2ErrorCollection always contains at least one iDB2Error object. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Exception.Message
member.summary: A string value that describes the exception. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Exception.MessageDetails
member.summary: A string value which may contain more detailed information about the exception. This property is read-only.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Exception.MessageCode
member.summary: An Int32 value that may give more detailed information about the error. In some cases, this will contain an SQL error code.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Exception.SqlState
member.summary: A String value that contains the SQLSTATE returned from the host server. This property will only return useful information for SQL errors. This property is read-only.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2SQLErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a functional error is received from the host for a SQL operation. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2SQLParameterErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a parameter error is received from the host for a SQL operation. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2HostErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an error is received from the iSeries host. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ExitProgramErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an exit program error is received from the host server. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2MaximumPoolSizeExceededException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a new pooled connection is requested to be opened, but the maximum pool size has been reached. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionFailedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a connection is requested to be opened, but an unexpected error occurs. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConnectionTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a connection is requested to be opened, but the connection timed out. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2UnsupportedHostVersionException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a connection iss requested to be opened, but the requested iSeries host version is not supported. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2DCFunctionErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an error is detected in a call to the data service component. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ConversionException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a conversion error is detected. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2CommErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an error is detected in the communications service component. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2InvalidConnectionStringException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the connection string is set to an invalid value. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Parameter.Size
member.summary: Maximum size of the parameter.
member.remarks: The Size property is used for binary and string types. For variable length data types, this is the maximum amount of data to transmit to the server. For non-string data types and ANSI string data, this is the number of bytes. For Unicode string data, Size refers to the number of characters. The count for strings does not include the terminating character. If not explicitly set, the size is inferred from the actual size of the specified parameter value. For fixed width data types, the value of Size is ignored. It can be retrieved for informational purposes, and returns the maximum amount of bytes the provider uses when transmitting the value of the parameter to the server.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings
member.summary: Provides a way to set process-global provider settings. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CleanupPooledConnections
member.summary: Performs orderly cleanup of pooled connections. Calling this method just before your process terminates will ensure pooled iDB2Connections get cleaned up properly. Make this method the last call you make before your process terminates.
member.remarks: In some cases, the .NET Framework does not allow finalizers sufficient time to perform proper cleanup. An example of when this might happen is when you have started host traces using one of the iDB2TraceOptions in your ConnectionString. If the pooled connection finalizers are not allowed to run to completion, you could end up with host trace objects that do not get cleaned up properly.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.ProviderVersion

member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2Date, iDB2Time, and iDB2TimeStamp to be treated as Strings instead of as DateTime.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.DecNumericAsString
member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2Decimal and iDB2Numeric to be treated as Strings instead of as Decimal.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CharBitDataAsString
member.summary: Allows parameters and data columns of type iDB2CharBitData and iDB2VarCharBitData to be treated as Strings instead of as a byte array.

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2ProviderSettings.CharBitDataCcsid
member.summary: Specifies the CCSID used to translate iDB2CharBitData and iDB2VarCharBitData types when the CharBitDataAsString property is set to True. This property is ignored when CharBitDataAsString is set to False.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Trace
member.summary: Provides a trace/log facility for the IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries Data Provider.
member.remarks: If your code uses special formatting or string building to produce trace data, then you should first check the Tracing or Logging property. This will allow your code to perform better in cases where tracing or logging is not on, since you won't go through the extra formatting or string building code which would end up being ignored.

member.name: T:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction
member.summary: Represents an object which can be used to commit or rollback changes to the iSeries database. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction to the database. Once the transaction is committed, no further operations are allowed on the iDB2Transaction object.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back a transaction from a pending state. Once the transaction is rolled back, no further operations are allowed on the iDB2Transaction object.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.Finalize
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by this transaction.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the managed and unmanaged resources used by this transaction.

member.name: M:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources used by this transaction.
member.param: A boolean value which indicates whether to release only unmanaged resources (false), or both managed and unmanaged resources (true).

member.name: P:IBM.Data.DB2.iSeries.iDB2Transaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets a value which specifies locking behavior for the connection and how changes in other transactions will be reflected in this transaction. This property is read-only.
